page.title: 08LANDSCAPE AROUND TRURO
page.content: The whole of Cornwall is hilly, and our area to the west of Truro is no exception. The area is basically green grass with only odd patches of brown (ploughed) land, divided into small fields by Cornish hedges (see Page 3). A strong westerly wind usually dominates the weather around the hills, which within some valleys small woodland grows allowing streams to flow among the trees. Apart from the buildings mentioned in Pages 6-7, some farmhouses that are in ruins can be seen on the hills. The London-Penzance railway line passes over one corner of our area, close to a Garden Centre. Along the southern edge of the area, like a scar on the landscape, runs part of the Truro by-pass road; a dual carriage-way.
